column1: Samantha Cristoforetti (born April 26, 1977 in Milan, Italy) is the third woman astronaut in the European Space Agency, and the first Italian woman astronaut.
She is scheduled to be a part of Expedition 42/43 aboard the International Space Station.
Cristoforetti was born in Milan in 1977.
She spent her childhood in Mal, in Val di Sole, Trentino, Italy.
She studied in Bolzano and Trento and graduated from the Technical University of Munich with a degree in Mechanical Engineering.
On July 3, 2012, the European Space Agency announced that Samantha Cristoforetti is set for a long-duration mission to the ISS in 2014.
